intro: Laportea mammosisetosa, commonly known as the fuzzy leaf or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, dandelion-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often described as velvety to the touch due to the dense covering of fine hairs. Laportea mammosisetosa is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings but has ecological value in supporting pollinators.
